77 // AI_MONITOR_FOR_OSCILLATION defaults to OFF. If you build with this ON, you can flag

105 //-------------------------------------
106 // Memory
107 //-------------------------------------
108 
109 #define MEMORY_CLEAR 0
110 #define bits_MEMORY_PROVOKED ( 1 << 0 )// right now only used for houndeyes.
111 #define bits_MEMORY_INCOVER ( 1 << 1 )// npc knows it is in a covered position.
112 #define bits_MEMORY_SUSPICIOUS ( 1 << 2 )// Ally is suspicious of the player, and will move to provoked more easily
113 #define bits_MEMORY_TASK_EXPENSIVE ( 1 << 3 )// NPC has completed a task which is considered costly, so don't do another task this frame
114 //#define bits_MEMORY_ ( 1 << 4 )
115 #define bits_MEMORY_PATH_FAILED ( 1 << 5 )// Failed to find a path
116 #define bits_MEMORY_FLINCHED ( 1 << 6 )// Has already flinched
117 //#define bits_MEMORY_ ( 1 << 7 )
118 #define bits_MEMORY_TOURGUIDE ( 1 << 8 )// I have been acting as a tourguide.
119 //#define bits_MEMORY_ ( 1 << 9 )//
120 #define bits_MEMORY_LOCKED_HINT ( 1 << 10 )//
121 //#define bits_MEMORY_ ( 1 << 12 )
122 
123 #define bits_MEMORY_TURNING ( 1 << 13 )// Turning, don't interrupt me.
124 #define bits_MEMORY_TURNHACK ( 1 << 14 )
125 
126 #define bits_MEMORY_HAD_ENEMY ( 1 << 15 )// Had an enemy
127 #define bits_MEMORY_HAD_PLAYER ( 1 << 16 )// Had player
128 #define bits_MEMORY_HAD_LOS ( 1 << 17 )// Had LOS to enemy
129 
130 #define bits_MEMORY_MOVED_FROM_SPAWN ( 1 << 18 )// Has moved since spawning.
131 
132 #define bits_MEMORY_CUSTOM4 ( 1 << 28 ) // NPC-specific memory
133 #define bits_MEMORY_CUSTOM3 ( 1 << 29 ) // NPC-specific memory
134 #define bits_MEMORY_CUSTOM2 ( 1 << 30 ) // NPC-specific memory
135 #define bits_MEMORY_CUSTOM1 ( 1 << 31 ) // NPC-specific memory
136 
137 //-------------------------------------
138 // Spawn flags
139 //-------------------------------------
140 #define SF_NPC_WAIT_TILL_SEEN ( 1 << 0 ) // spawnflag that makes npcs wait until player can see them before attacking.
141 #define SF_NPC_GAG ( 1 << 1 ) // no idle noises from this npc
142 #define SF_NPC_FALL_TO_GROUND ( 1 << 2 ) // used my NPC_Maker
143 #define SF_NPC_DROP_HEALTHKIT ( 1 << 3 ) // Drop a healthkit upon death
144 #define SF_NPC_START_EFFICIENT ( 1 << 4 ) // Set into efficiency mode from spawn
145 // ( 1 << 5 )
146 // ( 1 << 6 )
147 #define SF_NPC_WAIT_FOR_SCRIPT ( 1 << 7 ) // spawnflag that makes npcs wait to check for attacking until the script is done or they've been attacked
148 #define SF_NPC_LONG_RANGE ( 1 << 8 ) // makes npcs look far and relaxes weapon range limit
149 #define SF_NPC_FADE_CORPSE ( 1 << 9 ) // Fade out corpse after death
150 #define SF_NPC_ALWAYSTHINK ( 1 << 10 ) // Simulate even when player isn't in PVS.
151 #define SF_NPC_TEMPLATE ( 1 << 11 ) // This NPC will be used as a template by an npc_maker -- do not spawn.
152 #define SF_NPC_ALTCOLLISION ( 1 << 12 )
153 #define SF_NPC_NO_WEAPON_DROP ( 1 << 13 ) // This NPC will not actually drop a weapon that can be picked up
154 #define SF_NPC_NO_PLAYER_PUSHAWAY ( 1 << 14 )
155 // ( 1 << 15 )
156 // !! Flags above ( 1 << 15 ) are reserved for NPC sub-classes

164 enum CanPlaySequence_t
165 {
166  CANNOT_PLAY = 0, // Can't play for any number of reasons.
167  CAN_PLAY_NOW, // Can play the script immediately.
168  CAN_PLAY_ENQUEUED, // Can play the script after I finish playing my current script.
169 };

190 enum AI_Efficiency_t
191 {
192  // Run at full tilt
193  AIE_NORMAL,
194 
195  // Run decision process less often
196  AIE_EFFICIENT,
197 
198  // Run decision process even less often, ignore other NPCs
199  AIE_VERY_EFFICIENT,
200 
201  // Run decision process even less often, ignore other NPCs
202  AIE_SUPER_EFFICIENT,
203 
204  // Don't run at all
205  AIE_DORMANT,
206 };

355 // Allowable delta from the desired dynamic scripted sequence point
356 #define DSS_MAX_DIST 6
357 #define DSS_MAX_ANGLE_DIFF 4
358 
359 // Interaction Logic States
360 enum
361 {
362  NPCINT_NOT_RUNNING = 0,
363  NPCINT_RUNNING_ACTIVE, // I'm in an interaction that I initiated
364  NPCINT_RUNNING_PARTNER, // I'm in an interaction that was initiated by the other NPC
365  NPCINT_MOVING_TO_MARK, // I'm moving to a position to do an interaction
366 };
367 
368 #define NPCINT_NONE -1
369 
370 #define MAXTACLAT_IGNORE -1
371 
372 // -----------------------------------------
373 // A scripted interaction between NPCs
374 // -----------------------------------------
375 struct ScriptedNPCInteraction_t
376 {
377  ScriptedNPCInteraction_t()
378  {
379  iszInteractionName = NULL_STRING;
380  iFlags = 0;
381  iTriggerMethod = SNPCINT_CODE;
382  iLoopBreakTriggerMethod = 0;
383  vecRelativeOrigin = vec3_origin;
384  bValidOnCurrentEnemy = false;
385  flDelay = 5.0;
386  flDistSqr = (DSS_MAX_DIST * DSS_MAX_DIST);
387  flNextAttemptTime = 0;
388  iszMyWeapon = NULL_STRING;
389  iszTheirWeapon = NULL_STRING;
390 
391  for ( int i = 0; i < SNPCINT_NUM_PHASES; i++)
392  {
393  sPhases[i].iszSequence = NULL_STRING;
394  sPhases[i].iActivity = ACT_INVALID;
395  }
396  }
397 
398  // Fill out these when passing to AddScriptedNPCInteraction
399  string_t iszInteractionName;
400  int iFlags;
401  int iTriggerMethod;
402  int iLoopBreakTriggerMethod;
403  Vector vecRelativeOrigin; // (forward, right, up)
404  QAngle angRelativeAngles;
405  Vector vecRelativeVelocity; // Desired relative velocity of the other NPC
406  float flDelay; // Delay before interaction can be used again
407  float flDistSqr; // Max distance sqr from the relative origin the NPC is allowed to be to trigger
408  string_t iszMyWeapon; // Classname of the weapon I'm holding, if any
409  string_t iszTheirWeapon; // Classname of the weapon my interaction partner is holding, if any
410  ScriptedNPCInteraction_Phases_t sPhases[SNPCINT_NUM_PHASES];
411 
412  // These will be filled out for you in AddScriptedNPCInteraction
413  VMatrix matDesiredLocalToWorld; // Desired relative position / angles of the other NPC
414  bool bValidOnCurrentEnemy;
415 
416  float flNextAttemptTime;
417 
418  DECLARE_SIMPLE_DATADESC();
419 };

625  // Used by derived classes to chain a task to a task that might not be the
626  // one they are currently handling:
627  void ChainStartTask( int task, float taskData = 0 ) { Task_t tempTask = { task, taskData }; StartTask( (const Task_t *)&tempTask ); }
628  void ChainRunTask( int task, float taskData = 0 ) { Task_t tempTask = { task, taskData }; RunTask( (const Task_t *) &tempTask ); }

789  //-----------------------------------------------------
790  //
791  // Hooks for CAI_Behaviors, *if* derived class supports them
792  //
793  //-----------------------------------------------------
794  template <class BEHAVIOR_TYPE>
795  bool GetBehavior( BEHAVIOR_TYPE **ppBehavior )
796  {
797  CAI_BehaviorBase **ppBehaviors = AccessBehaviors();
798 
799  *ppBehavior = NULL;
800  for ( int i = 0; i < NumBehaviors(); i++ )
801  {
802  *ppBehavior = dynamic_cast<BEHAVIOR_TYPE *>(ppBehaviors[i]);
803  if ( *ppBehavior )
804  return true;
805  }
806  return false;
807  }
808 
809  virtual CAI_BehaviorBase *GetRunningBehavior() { return NULL; }
810 
811  virtual bool ShouldAcceptGoal( CAI_BehaviorBase *pBehavior, CAI_GoalEntity *pGoal ) { return true; }
812  virtual void OnClearGoal( CAI_BehaviorBase *pBehavior, CAI_GoalEntity *pGoal ) {}

2291 // ============================================================================
2292 // Macros for introducing new schedules in sub-classes
2293 //
2294 // Strings registries and schedules use unique ID's for each item, but
2295 // sub-class enumerations are non-unique, so we translate between the
2296 // enumerations and unique ID's
2297 // ============================================================================
2298 
2299 #define AI_BEGIN_CUSTOM_SCHEDULE_PROVIDER( derivedClass ) \
2300  IMPLEMENT_CUSTOM_SCHEDULE_PROVIDER(derivedClass ) \
2301  void derivedClass::InitCustomSchedules( void ) \
2302  { \
2303  typedef derivedClass CNpc; \
2304  const char *pszClassName = #derivedClass; \
2305  \
2306  CUtlVector<const char *> schedulesToLoad; \
2307  CUtlVector<AIScheduleLoadFunc_t> reqiredOthers; \
2308  CAI_NamespaceInfos scheduleIds; \
2309  CAI_NamespaceInfos taskIds; \
2310  CAI_NamespaceInfos conditionIds;
2311 
2312 
2313 //-----------------
2314 
2315 #define AI_BEGIN_CUSTOM_NPC( className, derivedClass ) \
2316  IMPLEMENT_CUSTOM_AI(className, derivedClass ) \
2317  void derivedClass::InitCustomSchedules( void ) \
2318  { \
2319  typedef derivedClass CNpc; \
2320  const char *pszClassName = #derivedClass; \
2321  \
2322  CUtlVector<const char *> schedulesToLoad; \
2323  CUtlVector<AIScheduleLoadFunc_t> reqiredOthers; \
2324  CAI_NamespaceInfos scheduleIds; \
2325  CAI_NamespaceInfos taskIds; \
2326  CAI_NamespaceInfos conditionIds; \
2327  CAI_NamespaceInfos squadSlotIds;
2328 
2329 //-----------------
2330 
2331 #define EXTERN_SCHEDULE( id ) \
2332  scheduleIds.PushBack( #id, id ); \
2333  extern const char * g_psz##id; \
2334  schedulesToLoad.AddToTail( g_psz##id );
2335 
2336 //-----------------
2337 
2338 #define DEFINE_SCHEDULE( id, text ) \
2339  scheduleIds.PushBack( #id, id ); \
2340  const char * g_psz##id = \
2341  "\n Schedule" \
2342  "\n " #id \
2343  text \
2344  "\n"; \
2345  schedulesToLoad.AddToTail( g_psz##id );
2346 
2347 //-----------------
2348 
2349 #define DECLARE_CONDITION( id ) \
2350  conditionIds.PushBack( #id, id );
2351 
2352 //-----------------
2353 
2354 #define DECLARE_TASK( id ) \
2355  taskIds.PushBack( #id, id );
2356 
2357 //-----------------
2358 
2359 #define DECLARE_ACTIVITY( id ) \
2360  ADD_CUSTOM_ACTIVITY( CNpc, id );
2361 
2362 //-----------------
2363 
2364 #define DECLARE_SQUADSLOT( id ) \
2365  squadSlotIds.PushBack( #id, id );
2366 
2367 //-----------------
2368 
2369 #define DECLARE_INTERACTION( interaction ) \
2370  ADD_CUSTOM_INTERACTION( interaction );
2371 
2372 //-----------------
2373 
2374 #define DECLARE_ANIMEVENT( id ) \
2375  ADD_CUSTOM_ANIMEVENT( CNpc, id );
2376 
2377 //-----------------
2378 
2379 #define DECLARE_USES_SCHEDULE_PROVIDER( classname ) reqiredOthers.AddToTail( ScheduleLoadHelper(classname) );
2380 
2381 //-----------------
2382 
2383 // IDs are stored and then added in order due to constraints in the namespace implementation
2384 #define AI_END_CUSTOM_SCHEDULE_PROVIDER() \
2385  \
2386  int i; \
2387  \
2388  CNpc::AccessClassScheduleIdSpaceDirect().Init( pszClassName, BaseClass::GetSchedulingSymbols(), &BaseClass::AccessClassScheduleIdSpaceDirect() ); \
2389  \
2390  scheduleIds.Sort(); \
2391  taskIds.Sort(); \
2392  conditionIds.Sort(); \
2393  \
2394  for ( i = 0; i < scheduleIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2395  { \
2396  ADD_CUSTOM_SCHEDULE_NAMED( CNpc, scheduleIds[i].pszName, scheduleIds[i].localId ); \
2397  } \
2398  \
2399  for ( i = 0; i < taskIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2400  { \
2401  ADD_CUSTOM_TASK_NAMED( CNpc, taskIds[i].pszName, taskIds[i].localId ); \
2402  } \
2403  \
2404  for ( i = 0; i < conditionIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2405  { \
2406  if ( ValidateConditionLimits( conditionIds[i].pszName ) ) \
2407  { \
2408  ADD_CUSTOM_CONDITION_NAMED( CNpc, conditionIds[i].pszName, conditionIds[i].localId ); \
2409  } \
2410  } \
2411  \
2412  for ( i = 0; i < reqiredOthers.Count(); i++ ) \
2413  { \
2414  (*reqiredOthers[i])(); \
2415  } \
2416  \
2417  for ( i = 0; i < schedulesToLoad.Count(); i++ ) \
2418  { \
2419  if ( CNpc::gm_SchedLoadStatus.fValid ) \
2420  { \
2421  CNpc::gm_SchedLoadStatus.fValid = g_AI_SchedulesManager.LoadSchedulesFromBuffer( pszClassName, schedulesToLoad[i], &AccessClassScheduleIdSpaceDirect() ); \
2422  } \
2423  else \
2424  break; \
2425  } \
2426  }
2427 
2428 inline bool ValidateConditionLimits( const char *pszNewCondition )
2429 {
2430  int nGlobalConditions = CAI_BaseNPC::GetSchedulingSymbols()->NumConditions();
2431  if ( nGlobalConditions >= MAX_CONDITIONS )
2432  {
2433  AssertMsg2( 0, "Exceeded max number of conditions (%d), ignoring condition %s\n", MAX_CONDITIONS, pszNewCondition );
2434  DevWarning( "Exceeded max number of conditions (%d), ignoring condition %s\n", MAX_CONDITIONS, pszNewCondition );
2435  return false;
2436  }
2437  return true;
2438 }
2439 
2440 
2441 //-------------------------------------
2442 
2443 // IDs are stored and then added in order due to constraints in the namespace implementation
2444 #define AI_END_CUSTOM_NPC() \
2445  \
2446  int i; \
2447  \
2448  CNpc::AccessClassScheduleIdSpaceDirect().Init( pszClassName, BaseClass::GetSchedulingSymbols(), &BaseClass::AccessClassScheduleIdSpaceDirect() ); \
2449  CNpc::gm_SquadSlotIdSpace.Init( &BaseClass::gm_SquadSlotNamespace, &BaseClass::gm_SquadSlotIdSpace); \
2450  \
2451  scheduleIds.Sort(); \
2452  taskIds.Sort(); \
2453  conditionIds.Sort(); \
2454  squadSlotIds.Sort(); \
2455  \
2456  for ( i = 0; i < scheduleIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2457  { \
2458  ADD_CUSTOM_SCHEDULE_NAMED( CNpc, scheduleIds[i].pszName, scheduleIds[i].localId ); \
2459  } \
2460  \
2461  for ( i = 0; i < taskIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2462  { \
2463  ADD_CUSTOM_TASK_NAMED( CNpc, taskIds[i].pszName, taskIds[i].localId ); \
2464  } \
2465  \
2466  for ( i = 0; i < conditionIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2467  { \
2468  if ( ValidateConditionLimits( conditionIds[i].pszName ) ) \
2469  { \
2470  ADD_CUSTOM_CONDITION_NAMED( CNpc, conditionIds[i].pszName, conditionIds[i].localId ); \
2471  } \
2472  } \
2473  \
2474  for ( i = 0; i < squadSlotIds.Count(); i++ ) \
2475  { \
2476  ADD_CUSTOM_SQUADSLOT_NAMED( CNpc, squadSlotIds[i].pszName, squadSlotIds[i].localId ); \
2477  } \
2478  \
2479  for ( i = 0; i < reqiredOthers.Count(); i++ ) \
2480  { \
2481  (*reqiredOthers[i])(); \
2482  } \
2483  \
2484  for ( i = 0; i < schedulesToLoad.Count(); i++ ) \
2485  { \
2486  if ( CNpc::gm_SchedLoadStatus.fValid ) \
2487  { \
2488  CNpc::gm_SchedLoadStatus.fValid = g_AI_SchedulesManager.LoadSchedulesFromBuffer( pszClassName, schedulesToLoad[i], &AccessClassScheduleIdSpaceDirect() ); \
2489  } \
2490  else \
2491  break; \
2492  } \
2493  }

2500  : pszName( pszName ),
2501  localId( localId )

2509 class CAI_NamespaceInfos : public CUtlVector<AI_NamespaceAddInfo_t>
2510 {

2513  {
2514  AddToTail( AI_NamespaceAddInfo_t( pszName, localId ) );
2515  }
2516 
2517  void Sort()
2518  {
2519  CUtlVector<AI_NamespaceAddInfo_t>::Sort( Compare );
2520  }
2521 
2522 private:
2523  static int __cdecl Compare(const AI_NamespaceAddInfo_t *pLeft, const AI_NamespaceAddInfo_t *pRight )
2524  {
2525  return pLeft->localId - pRight->localId;
2526  }
2527 
2528 };

2535 struct AI_SchedLoadStatus_t
2536 {
2537  bool fValid;
2538  int signature;
2539 };
2540 
2541 // Load schedules pulled out to support stepping through with debugger
2542 inline bool AI_DoLoadSchedules( bool (*pfnBaseLoad)(), void (*pfnInitCustomSchedules)(),
2543  AI_SchedLoadStatus_t *pLoadStatus )
2544 {
2545  (*pfnBaseLoad)();
2546 
2547  if (pLoadStatus->signature != g_AI_SchedulesManager.GetScheduleLoadSignature())
2548  {
2549  (*pfnInitCustomSchedules)();
2550  pLoadStatus->fValid = true;
2551  pLoadStatus->signature = g_AI_SchedulesManager.GetScheduleLoadSignature();
2552  }
2553  return pLoadStatus->fValid;
2554 }

3045 abstract_class INPCInteractive
3046 {
3047 public:
3048  virtual bool CanInteractWith( CAI_BaseNPC *pUser ) = 0;
3049  virtual bool HasBeenInteractedWith() = 0;
3050  virtual void NotifyInteraction( CAI_BaseNPC *pUser ) = 0;
3051

3054  virtual void AlyxFinishedInteraction( void ) = 0;
3055 };
3056 
3057 // Base Class for any NPC that wants to be interactable by other NPCS (i.e. Alyx Hackable)
3058 // NOTE: YOU MUST DEFINE THE OUTPUTS IN YOUR CLASS'S DATADESC!
3059 // THE DO SO, INSERT THE FOLLOWING MACRO INTO YOUR CLASS'S DATADESC.
3060 //
3061 #define DEFINE_BASENPCINTERACTABLE_DATADESC() \
3062  DEFINE_OUTPUT( m_OnAlyxStartedInteraction, "OnAlyxStartedInteraction" ), \
3063  DEFINE_OUTPUT( m_OnAlyxFinishedInteraction, "OnAlyxFinishedInteraction" ), \
3064  DEFINE_INPUTFUNC( FIELD_VOID, "InteractivePowerDown", InputPowerdown )
3065 
3066 template <class NPC_CLASS>
3067 class CNPCBaseInteractive : public NPC_CLASS, public INPCInteractive
3068 {
3069  DECLARE_CLASS( CNPCBaseInteractive, NPC_CLASS );
3070 public:
3071  virtual bool CanInteractWith( CAI_BaseNPC *pUser ) { return false; };
3072  virtual bool HasBeenInteractedWith() { return false; };
3073  virtual void NotifyInteraction( CAI_BaseNPC *pUser ) { return; };
3074 
3075  virtual void InputPowerdown( inputdata_t &inputdata )
3076  {
3077 
3078  }
3079 
3080  // Alyx specific interactions
3081  virtual void AlyxStartedInteraction( void )
3082  {
3083  m_OnAlyxStartedInteraction.FireOutput( this, this );
3084  }
3085  virtual void AlyxFinishedInteraction( void )
3086  {
3087  m_OnAlyxFinishedInteraction.FireOutput( this, this );
3088  }
3089 
3090 public:
3091  // Outputs
3092  // Alyx specific interactions
3093  COutputEvent m_OnAlyxStartedInteraction;
3094  COutputEvent m_OnAlyxFinishedInteraction;
3095 };

3102
